content: Deploy Hugo and Further The following operations is based on the post, â€œHugo With LoveIt Theme Configurationâ€, which requires you have already installed and config both Hugo and LoveIt theme.
title: Deploy Hugo and Further

content: 1. Deploy Hugo on Github Assume you have already got a Github account. Create a Github Repository, name this repository as yourgithubname.github.io. Open your terminal, and cd to your blog folder. Run following command lines: hugo --theme=loveit --baseUrl="https://yourgithubname.github.io/" # To build static pages, which will generate public folder cd public git init git remote add origin https://github.com/yourgithubname/yourgithubname.github.io.git git add . git commit -m "first commit" git push After a few seconds, your blog is online!
title: Deploy Hugo and Further

content: 1. Add Comment Box to Your Blog 1-1. Install utterances on your repo. The easiest way for you to add comment box is adding utterances.es comment box. Here is the brief intruduction of utterances.es: https://utteranc.es/ 1-2. Open quickstart/config.toml file, and set utterances.es related setting like following. [params.page.comment.utterances] enable = true # owner/repo repo = "yourgithubname/yourgithubname.github.io" issueTerm = "pathname" label = "" lightTheme = "github-light" darkTheme = "github-dark" 1-3. Set enable = false under [params.page.comment.valine] 1-4. Rebuild your blog and redeploy your public folder. 1-5. Enjoy commentingğŸ»
title: Deploy Hugo and Further

content: 2. Add Advanced Search (Algolia) Ability to Your Blog 2-1. Create algolia account: https://www.algolia.com/ 2-2. Create an application under your algolia account; [Choose Experienced User, continue all the way down] 2-3. Configure your application; [Click Indice in the left sidebar, click Create Index in the right sidebar just pop out, choose a name you like as Index name] 2-4. Add your algolia application related API Keys into your config.toml file. You can find API Key on the sidebar in algolia website. title: Hugo and LoveIt Theme Config

content: 1. Install Hugo # Install hugo by homebrew brew install hugo # Make sure that you install hugo successfully hugo version # Cd to Desktop directory cd Desktop # Create new hugo site in Desktop directory hugo new site quickstart
title: Hugo and LoveIt Theme Config

content: Install LoveIt Theme # Cd to quickstart directory cd quickstart # init your own git repository git init # Install LoveIt theme from github git submodule add https://github.com/dillonzq/LoveIt.git themes/LoveIt # add and commit your site git add . git commit -m "Added LoveIt Theme"

content: 3-0 Add Your Avatar Image If you are following every step above this post, so your Avatar Image should be underquickstart/static/images folder. Also, naming your avatar image as avatar.jpg
title: Hugo and LoveIt Theme Config

content: 3-1 Create Your First Post hugo new posts/first_post.md The default content in first_post.md: --- title: "{{ replace .Name "-" " " | title }}" date: {{ .Date }} draft: true --- The default content is generated by quickstart/archetypes/default.md, you can change the default content in that file! By default all posts and pages are created as a draft. So this first_post will not be shown in your site. Please do change draft: true to draft: false
title: Hugo and LoveIt Theme Config

content: 3-2 Start Hugo Server # add all change files to your master branch and commit git add . git commit -m "Finished init configuration of hugo as well as loveit theme" hugo server
title: Hugo and LoveIt Theme Config

content: 3-3 Visit Your Brand New Blog You can visit your blog locally: http://localhost:1313
title: Hugo and LoveIt Theme Config

content: 3-4 You Did It! As you can see, you cannot find your very first post in that blog. And when you click posts, the blog goes wrong! To fix this problem, you need to replace the content in quickstart/theme/loveit/layouts/partials/function/content.html by the following content: {{- $content := .Content -}} {{- if ne "" $content -}} {{- if .Ruby -}} {{- $content = partial "function/ruby.html" $content -}} {{- end -}} {{- if .Fraction -}} {{- $content = partial "function/fraction.html" $content -}} {{- end -}} {{- if .Fontawesome -}} {{- $content = partial "function/fontawesome.html" $content -}} {{- end -}} {{- $content = partial "function/checkbox.html" $content -}} {{- $content = partial "function/escape.html" $content -}} {{- end -}} {{- return $content -}} After that you can see your posts on both main page and posts subpage Do commit your blog folder to keep everything work! git add . git commit -m "Fixed the posts not show error"
title: Hugo and LoveIt Theme Config
